poem:
Title: "Dance of the Disklavier"

In lockdown's eerie quiet, a dance was born,
a Disklavier duet, spectral and forlorn.
Moran's fingers, in metered might, spun tales of unison,
while her ghostly twin echoed in augmented fun.
Not canonical elegance, but a rhythm of the reclusive, 
Casting resonances that felt musically elusive.
Beyond the silence, a symphony was woven,
In echoes of solitude, a message proven.
